intro: Rohria spinosissima, commonly known as the spiny rohria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves, which help it survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or orange. Rohria spinosissima is adapted to low rainfall and can thrive in sandy or rocky soils.
